greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle defined by T(n,k) = binomial(n*k, k^2), for n>=0, k=0..n, as read by rows.
comment: Central coefficients are A201555(n) = C(2*n^2,n^2) = A000984(n^2), where A000984 is the central binomial coefficients.
link: Paul D. Hanna, Rows 0..30, as a flattened table of n, a(n) for n = 0..495
example: The triangle of coefficients C(n*k, k^2), n>=k, k=0..n, begins:
program: for(n=0, 10, for(k=0, n, print1(T(n, k), ", ")); print(""))
xref: Cf. A228808 (row sums), A228833 (antidiagonal sums), A135860 (diagonal), A201555 (central terms).
Cf. related triangles: A228904 (exp), A209330, A226234, A228836.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 04 2013
